Description:
As a Production Operator, you will be responsible for operating and maintaining production equipment in a manufacturing environment. Your main goal will be to ensure that production runs smoothly and efficiently while following all safety procedures. You will work closely with other team members to meet production targets and maintain quality standards.Responsibilities:Set up and operate production equipment, such as machines, conveyors, and assembly lines.
Monitor production processes and make adjustments as necessary to ensure optimal efficiency and quality.
Perform routine maintenance on production equipment to prevent breakdowns and delays.
Inspect finished products for defects and ensure they meet quality standards.
Follow all safety procedures and wear appropriate personal protective equipment.
Maintain accurate production records and report any issues or concerns to the supervisor.
Collaborate with other team members to meet production targets and deadlines.
Ensure that the work area is clean and organized at all times.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance production processes and reduce waste.
Adhere to all company policies and procedures.Skills
Skills:
High school diploma or equivalent.
Prior experience working in a manufacturing environment.
Strong mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and drawings.
Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions accurately.
Good communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet production targets.
Flexibility to work different shifts, including nights and weekends.
Basic computer skills.
Physical stamina to stand, walk, and lift heavy objects for extended periods.

Machine operation
Equipment maintenance
